intro: Cathartolinum guatemalense, commonly known as the Guatemalan cathartolinum, is a flowering plant native to the highlands of Guatemala. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments within cloud forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
